abstract: Editorial castigates China for arrest of five women's rights advocates for handing out leaflets as part of campaign against sexual harassment on public transportation; contends arrest of women, who were affiliated with human rights organization Beijing Yirenping Center, represents regressive crackdown on free speech under Pres Xi Jinping; holds Xi is squandering opportunity to forge new human rights legacy for country.
lead_paragraph: President Xi Jinping has a chance to embrace human rights. Instead, by arresting five activists, he appears to be succumbing to Communist Party history.

headline.main: China’s Fear of Women With Pamphlets
headline.print_headline: China’s Fear of Women With Pamphlets

snippet: President Xi Jinping has a chance to embrace human rights. Instead, by arresting five activists, he appears to be succumbing to Communist Party history.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
